title: NNVCD Local Terminology Normalization to ACLED Categories
description: Rules for converting local Nigerian conflict terminology to standardized ACLED actor and event categories

actor_mapping.context: Often used in Southeast Nigeria for unidentified attackers, potentially linked to separatist movements
Commonly refers to criminal groups in Northwest and North Central Nigeria engaged in kidnapping and cattle rustling
Refers to nomadic pastoralist groups, often Fulani, involved in farmer-herder conflicts
Refers to violent youth gangs or secret societies, often in urban or university settings
Local self-defense groups, sometimes state-sanctioned, responding to insecurity
Generic term for military, police, or other government security personnel

event_mapping.context: Used for violent confrontations between groups
Often used when civilians or communities are targeted
Specific to anti-police brutality movements, may turn violent
Ethnic or land disputes between communities
